titleStmt.title: Threni Hybernici: or, Ireland sympathising with England and Scotland, in a sad lamentation for the loss of their Josiah Represented in a sermon at Christ-Church in Dublin before His Excellency the Lord Deputy, with divers of the nobility, gentry, and commonality there assembled, to celebrate a funerall solemnity upon the death of the late Lord Protector. By Dr. Harrison, chief chaplain to his said Excellency.
titleStmt.author: Harrison, Thomas, 1619-1682.

titleStmt.title: Threni Hybernici: or, Ireland sympathising with England and Scotland, in a sad lamentation for the loss of their Josiah Represented in a sermon at Christ-Church in Dublin before His Excellency the Lord Deputy, with divers of the nobility, gentry, and commonality there assembled, to celebrate a funerall solemnity upon the death of the late Lord Protector. By Dr. Harrison, chief chaplain to his said Excellency.
titleStmt.author: Harrison, Thomas, 1619-1682.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Robert Clavell, at the Staggs-head by St. Gregories Church in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in Dr. Williams' Library, London.
